articles.title: DPRK Anniversaries to Be Observed in Thailand
articles.content:
DPRK Anniversaries to Be Observed in Thailand 
    Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- An inaugural ceremony of the Thai preparatory committee for commemorating the Day of the Sun and February 16 was held in Bangkok on Jan. 24.
 The president of the Social Development Coordinating Center of Thailand was elected chairman of the preparatory committee at the ceremony. 
 The preparatory committee set a commemoration period from February to April and decided to organize multifarious functions during the period.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Settle Its Past Crimes
S. Korean Government Employees' Union Joins in KCTU
articles.content:
S. Korean Government Employees' Union Joins in KCTU 
    Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Government Employees' Union decided to join in the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU), according to the south Korean MBC on Jan. 27.
 The union in a statement noted that its joining in the KCTU is an expression of its will to launch a struggle for changing south Korean society together with the KCTU.    
 The MBC said that it brought the KCTU to the first largest confederation of trade unions embracing at least 800,000 unionists.

articles.title: S. Korean Moviemen Protest against Authorities' Measure
articles.content:
S. Korean Moviemen Protest against Authorities' Measure 
    Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The Moviemen's Measure Committee of south Korea called an emergency press conference on Jan. 26 to protest against the government authorities' submission to the U.S. pressure on trade, according to the south Korean MBC.
 The organization denounced the authorities' measures for cutting down screen quarter of south Korean films under the U.S. pressure as an "anti-cultural coup" and urged the minister of Finance and Economy and others responsible for this to resign immediately.    
 The organization made public its action program.

articles.title: Russian Ambassador Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Russian Ambassador Hosts Reception 
    Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Andrei Karlov hosted a reception at the embassy on Tuesday evening in honor of members of the Korean Council of Religionists on the occasion of the New Year Juche 95 (2006).
 Invited to the reception were Ho Il Jin, chairman of the Korean Orthodox Church Committee, and members of the Korean Council of Religionists.
 Staff members of the Russian embassy were on hand.    
 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: Ugandan President Supports Kim Jong Il's Songun Politics
articles.content:
Ugandan President Supports Kim Jong Il's Songun Politics 
    Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Ugandan President Yoweri Kaguta Museveni stressed that he invariably supports the Songun politics of leader Kim Jong Il defending the sovereignty and dignity of Korea. Korea's reunification should be realized by the Korean people themselves as specified by the June 15 joint declaration, he added.
 He met with the delegation of the Korean Democratic Women's Union headed by Chairperson of its Central Committee Pak Sun Hui on a visit to Uganda at the Presidential Palace on Jan. 27.    
 Impressively recalling the fact that he visited Korea in the past and was received by President Kim Il Sung, the Ugandan president said that he would make positive efforts to boost the friendly relations between the two countries.

Animated Cartoon Film Hall Popular with Schoolchildren
articles.content:
Animated Cartoon Film Hall Popular with Schoolchildren
    Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- A lot of schoolchildren on winter vacation visit the hall of the Korean April 26 Cartoon Film Studio in Pyongyang everyday to watch animated cartoons.
 Now on the screen are several pieces of long cartoon films including "A Boy Defeats Robbers" and newly released animated films "Story on Traffic Order"(serial films), "Cho Tong and His Father", "Three Ant Brothers" and "Newly Acquainted Friend".    
 The animated films give the versatile knowledge of things and phenomena to children and also lessons that they should be possessed of kind and beautiful moral characters from younger days in humorous way. They are very popular among children for their successful depiction suitable to their psychology.
 The hall annually shows more than 400 pieces of animated films including "The Hedgehog Beats the Tiger", "Prince of Hodong and Princess of Raknang" and "Blue Springwater" (three parts) and "A Squirrel and a Hedgehog", "The Clever Racoon Dog" and "The Tinkling of a Bell" which are under serial creation.

articles.title: Preparations for Day of Sun and February 16 Brisk Abroad
DPRK-Japan Inter-governmental Talks to be Held
articles.content:
DPRK-Japan Inter-governmental Talks to be Held
    Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The DPRK-Japan inter-governmental talks for the normalization of bilateral relations are to be held in Beijing from Feb. 4.
 The talks will discuss pending issues of mutual concern including issues related to Japan's settlement of its past, the security issue and the abduction issue.

articles.title: Officials of DPRK Visit Polish Embassy to Offer Condolences
articles.content:
Officials of DPRK Visit Polish Embassy to Offer Condolences
    Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Officials of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Ministry of Foreign Trade, the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and the Bureau of Diplomatic Corps Affairs today paid visits to the Polish embassy here to express condolences over the casualties caused by a tragic accident that took place in Katowice.
 The visitors made entries in the mourner's book.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Polish President
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Polish President
    Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today sent a message of sympathy to Polish President Lech Aleksander Kaczynski over the casualties caused by a tragic accident that took place in Katowice.
 In the message Kim expressed deep condolences to the president and, through him, to the victims and their bereaved families and hoped that the wounded would recover as quickly as possible.
